sentence.Network_en: They go for decorous walks every day in parks with their nanny.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们每天都和保姆一起在公园里散步，表现得很有教养。

sentence.Network_en: Hiring a nanny has turned out to be the perfect solution.
sentence.Network_cn: 雇用保姆结果成了解决问题的最佳方法。

sentence.Network_en: I have a live-in nanny for my youngest daughter.
sentence.Network_cn: 我为小女儿请了个住家保姆。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (as a noun): pet form of the given name Ann. The verb dates from the 1950s

entry.def: A nanny is a woman who is paid by parents to look after their child or children.

means.word_mean: 1. a woman who is the custodian of children

auth_sentence.content: Svetlana has been your live-in nanny for seven years.
auth_sentence.res_content: Svetlana has been your live-in nanny for seven years.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Svetlana has been your live-in nanny for seven years.

auth_sentence.content: With the...installation of Winifred's old nanny as housekeeper.
auth_sentence.res_content: With the...installation of Winifred's old nanny as housekeeper.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: With the...installation of Winifred's old nanny as housekeeper.

auth_sentence.content: Unfortunately the 'nanny' state is fast becoming a reality.
auth_sentence.res_content: Unfortunately the 'nanny' state is fast becoming a reality.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Unfortunately the 'nanny' state is fast becoming a reality.

sentences.en: She was taken on as a nanny to their two small children.
sentences.cn: 她受雇为他们的两个小孩当保母。

sentences.en: She had to choose between giving up her job or hiring a nanny.
sentences.cn: 她得在放弃工作和雇保姆之间作出抉择。

sentences.en: They have a nanny living in.
sentences.cn: 他们有个保姆住在家里。

means.word_mean: 保姆式国家(指过分干涉国民生活并对其实行家长式管治的国家)

sentences.en: We’re living in a nanny state; the government watches over you for everything and nobody’s responsible for their own actions any more.
sentences.cn: 我们所在的国家是保姆式的，你的一切都受政府的监控，人们不再对自己的行为负责。
